intro: Diphyes inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal diphyes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are often unequal in size on either side of the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying a combination of white and yellow hues. The botanical features of Diphyes inaequalis make it an interesting subject for study in tropical flora.
